title: Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Dai-ichi Life Takes ¥140 Billion Loss Selling Off Long Bonds

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Bloomberg

Dai-ichi Life Insurance Co. incurred a loss of approximately ¥140 billion ($890 million) by selling long-term bonds in anticipation of rising interest rates. The company sold ¥500 billion in Japanese government bonds, primarily of longer maturities, in the first half of the fiscal year.

  • The sales were concentrated in the first half of the fiscal year, with plans for more restrained activity in the second half.
  • President Toshiaki Sumino assured that the loss would not impact the company's financial soundness.
  • Dai-ichi Life holds ¥18.9 trillion in yen-denominated bonds.
  • Sumino predicts a rate hike by the Bank of Japan due to the economy showing signs of recovery.
  • The company is focused on replacing sold assets while being mindful of profit impacts.
  • Annualized premiums from new contracts rose significantly in the first half of fiscal 2024, marking a recovery from previous scandals.
“I don’t think the loss will have any impact on our financial soundness,” said Sumino.

Overall, Dai-ichi Life is navigating the challenges posed by the changing interest rate environment while also working to rebound from past setbacks.
newTitle: Dai-ichi Life Reports Loss from Long Bond Sales Amid Interest Rate Preparations

title: Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Vinay Hiremath, co-founder of Loom, expressed confusion after selling his startup for $975 million, revealing his struggles with newfound wealth and direction in life.

  • Hiremath sold Loom to Atlassian for $975 million in 2023.
  • He shared his thoughts in a blog post, detailing feelings of aimlessness despite financial freedom.
  • He apologized to his ex-girlfriend, reflecting on personal insecurities affecting his relationships.
  • He considered starting a robotics company but felt uninspired by the idea.
  • Hiremath attempted to work for Elon Musk, describing it as a valuable experience.
  • After an ill-fated expedition in the Himalayas, he is currently in Hawaii learning physics to build a foundation for future ventures.
“After selling my company, I find myself in the totally un-relatable position of never having to work again.”

Hiremath’s journey highlights the emotional challenges that can accompany sudden wealth and the search for purpose beyond financial success.
newTitle: Indian-origin founder clueless after selling $975 million firm: ‘No idea what to do’

title: What is the salary of Apple's new Indian-origin CFO Kevan Parekh? Details here - Hindustan Times
summary:
Apple's New CFO Kevan Parekh: Salary and Background Details

Date: January 5, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

This article discusses the appointment of Kevan Parekh as the new Chief Financial Officer (CFO) of Apple Inc., effective January 1, 2025, along with details of his salary and professional background.

  • Kevan Parekh's annual salary is set at $1 million (₹8.57 crore).
  • Parekh joined Apple in June 2013 and held previous roles in financial planning and analysis.
  • He succeeds Luca Maestri as part of a planned transition.
  • Parekh has extensive experience with Thomson Reuters and General Motors.
  • Apple's CEO Tim Cook praised Parekh's intellect and judgment in his appointment announcement.
“For more than a decade, Kevan has been an indispensable member of Apple's finance leadership team...” - Tim Cook

Parekh's leadership is expected to steer Apple's financial strategies effectively as he steps into this significant role.
newTitle: Apple's New CFO Kevan Parekh: Salary and Background Details

title: Etihad Airways flight aborts takeoff at Melbourne airport after tyre burst, passengers evacuated safely - The Times of India
summary:
Etihad Airways Flight Abort Soaring at Melbourne Airport Due to Tyre Burst

Publication Date: N/A | Source: N/A

An Etihad Airways flight had to abort its takeoff at Melbourne Airport after experiencing a tyre burst, leading to the safe evacuation of passengers.

  • The incident occurred during takeoff.
  • All passengers were evacuated safely without injury.
  • The flight's safety protocols were effectively executed.
“Safety is our top priority and our team acted quickly to ensure all passengers were unharmed.”

The swift action taken ensured the safety of all onboard, highlighting the importance of aircraft safety measures.

title: Stocks To Watch on January 6: HDFC Bank, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Vedanta and more - CNBCTV18
summary:
Stocks To Watch on January 6: HDFC Bank, ITC, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Vedanta and More

Date: January 6, 2024

Source: CNBC TV18

This article highlights key stocks to monitor in the trade on January 6, including significant updates and announcements from various companies.

  • HDFC Bank: Reported a year-on-year growth in gross advances by 3% and deposits by 15.8%; however, CASA deposits decreased by 4.4%.
  • ITC: Record date for ITC Hotels demerger where shareholders will receive one ITC Hotels share for every 10 ITC shares.
  • Kotak Mahindra Bank: CTO and COO Milind Nagnur has resigned, effective February 15, 2025.
  • ICICI Bank: Received a GST demand and penalty order of ₹100.76 crore from Maharashtra's GST Department.
  • Bajaj Finance: Announced a business update with AUM growing by 28% year-on-year.
  • Vedanta: Production increased by 3% in Q3 FY25 with record-high mined metal production.
  • Premier Explosives: A fire in Telangana factory resulted in one fatality and severe injuries.
  • NTPC Green: Secured 1000 MW capacity in a bid at ₹2.56 per kWh from UPPCL.
  • Andhra Paper: Production disrupted due to a workers' strike at its Rajahmundry plant.
  • UCO Bank: Reported a 16.2% increase in total advances in Q3 FY25.
  • Quess Corp: Announced an income tax refund of ₹124.80 crore for FY24.

title: Adani Wilmar to expand FMCG portfolio, emulates ITC post-Adani group exit - Business Standard
summary:
Adani Wilmar to Expand FMCG Portfolio, Emulating ITC Post-Adani Group Exit

Publication Date: N/A Source: Business Standard

Adani Wilmar Ltd (AWL), India's largest edible oil company, is adopting a strategy akin to ITC's to bolster its FMCG portfolio following the exit of the Adani group. By leveraging its dominant edible oil business and extensive distribution network, AWL aims to achieve growth in high-margin FMCG products.

  • AWL's FMCG segment achieved a 24% year-on-year growth in volume in the December quarter.
  • The overall share of food and FMCG in volumes increased to 20%, and in revenues to 9%.
  • Key packaged products in the food category saw robust double-digit growth.
  • AWL's significant distribution network reaches 2.1 million outlets.
  • Due to higher oil prices, revenue from the edible oil segment increased by 39% year-on-year.
  • AWL's total revenues grew by 33%, surpassing analysts' expectations.
  • Gautam Adani's group sold its entire stake in AWL for over USD 2 billion.
“Our integrated distribution model is helping us capitalise on the strength of our oil distribution network to expand the reach of our food products, particularly in urban markets.”

With these strategic moves, AWL plans to introduce global FMCG brands into the Indian market, following the exit of the Adani Group.
newTitle: Adani Wilmar to Expand FMCG Portfolio, Emulating ITC Post-Adani Group Exit

title: Petrol Pump booked for delivering deficit fuel to consumers in Anantnag - Greater Kashmir
summary:
Petrol Pump in Anantnag Penalized for Deficient Fuel Delivery

Date: Jan 05, 2023 Source: Greater Kashmir

A petrol pump on National Highway Anantnag has been booked for delivering less fuel to consumers following a surprise inspection by the Enforcement unit of Legal Metrology Anantnag.

  • The inspection revealed that every 5 litres delivered was short by 30 ml.
  • The display boards at the petrol pump were found to be inaccurate.
  • The nozzle was seized, and prosecution under the Legal Metrology Act has begun against the pump owner.
  • Consumers are encouraged to check fuel delivery using a verified 5 litre measure, which should be visible at all petrol pumps.
  • Consumer rights awareness was promoted in the local community, with a toll-free number provided for complaints.
“Accuracy in the quantity of goods or fuel is the basic right of consumers.”

Consumers in the area appreciated the enforcement action and have been informed about their rights to ensure fair delivery of fuel.
newTitle: Petrol Pump in Anantnag Penalized for Deficient Fuel Delivery

title: Post-Adani exit, Wilmar to emulate ITC; leverage cash-cow oil business to expand FMCG portfolio - The Economic Times
HDFC Bank's LDR falls below 100% for the first time after merger - Business Standard
summary:
HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

HDFC Bank's loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) has fallen below 100% for the first time since its merger with HDFC Ltd. This decline is attributed to slower loan growth and the securitisation of a significant portion of loans in Q3 of FY25.

  • HDFC Bank’s LDR is now at 99.2%, down from 100.76% in Q2 of FY25.
  • The LDR was 111.53% in Q3 of 2023-24.
  • The decrease is in line with the bank’s guidance for more cautious loan growth.
"The easing of the LDR aligns with the bank’s guidance, which indicated that it would grow its loan book more cautiously."

This drop below the critical 100% mark signifies a strategic shift in HDFC Bank’s approach to lending post-merger.
newTitle: HDFC Bank's Loan-to-Deposit Ratio Drops Below 100% for the First Time Post-Merger

title: Upcoming Tata Cars Launching This Year – Tiago Facelift To Harrier EV - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Upcoming Tata Cars Launching This Year - Tiago Facelift To Harrier EV

Tata Motors is looking to enrich its lineup with several launches, focusing on both electric vehicles and facelifted versions of existing models in 2025.

  • The Harrier EV will debut at the 2025 Bharat Mobility Expo.
  • Facelifts for the Tiago and Tigor are expected, introducing new features and design updates.
  • The Sierra EV and its ICE version are also in the pipeline for release.
  • The Punch facelift, incorporating modern tech, is anticipated soon.

The upcoming Tata cars aim to cater to the growing demand for electric vehicles while updating existing models to meet customer expectations.

title: United Airlines accelerates its Starlink rollout, with first commercial flight planned for spring - TechCrunch
summary:
United Airlines Accelerates Starlink Rollout with Upcoming Commercial Flight

Publication Date: September 17, 2024

Source: TechCrunch

United Airlines has announced a swift timeline for the rollout of Starlink, aiming to enhance in-flight internet access for passengers. Testing will begin next month, with the first commercial flight expected this spring.

  • United Airlines will start testing Starlink in October 2024.
  • The first passenger flight featuring Starlink will take off in spring.
  • Starlink aims to enhance in-flight Wi-Fi, allowing streaming and gaming.
  • Free Wi-Fi will be available for MileagePlus members on all planes equipped with Starlink.
  • The airline expects to retrofit its entire regional fleet by the year’s end.
“It’s not only going to revolutionize the experience of flying United, but it’s also going to unlock tons of new partnerships and benefits for our members that otherwise wouldn’t be possible.” - Richard Nunn, CEO of United’s MileagePlus program

The implementation of Starlink represents a significant advancement in United Airlines' service, promising to improve passenger connectivity and enhance the flying experience.
newTitle: United Airlines Accelerates Starlink Rollout with Upcoming Commercial Flight

title: Earning Rs 48 crore per day, Indian-origin techie is world's highest paid person - Deccan Herald
summary:
Indian-Origin Techie Jagdeep Singh Earns Rs 48 Crore Per Day

Published: 05 January 2025, 12:47 IST

This article highlights the astonishing earnings of Jagdeep Singh, who has become the highest-paid employee in the world with a daily income of Rs 48 crore. His achievements and career trajectory are also outlined.

  • Jagdeep Singh's annual salary is Rs 17,500 crore.
  • He is a founder of QuantumScape, an electric vehicle battery company.
  • Singh's daily earnings surpass the annual revenues of many large companies.
  • He previously worked at Hewlett-Packard and Sun Microsystems.
  • Singh has a BTech from Stanford University and an MBA from UC Berkeley.
  • QuantumScape focuses on solid-state battery technology for electric vehicles.
  • In February 2023, Singh stepped down as CEO of QuantumScape but continues as Chairman of the Board.
"His daily wage is greater than the annual revenue of many prominent companies."

Jagdeep Singh's remarkable financial success highlights the potential of innovative technology in transforming industries.

title: Trade Setup For Jan. 6: Nifty May Test 24,650 On Breakout Above 24,130 - NDTV Profit
summary:
Trade Setup For Jan. 6: Nifty May Test 24,650 On Breakout Above 24,130

Date: January 6, 2025
Source: Bloomberg Quint

The market analysis suggests that the NSE Nifty 50 is positioned for a potential breakout that could push it towards 24,650 if it surpasses the immediate resistance at 24,130. Analysts are carefully observing key support and resistance levels.

  • The Nifty 50 closed at 24,004.75, down 183.90 points (0.76%).
  • Immediate support is noted at 23,900 with major resistance at 24,130.
  • A breakout above 24,130 could lead to a rise towards 24,650.
  • Profit booking has influenced market movements, but overall investor sentiment shows strength with the index above the 200-day moving average.
  • Foreign portfolio investors have turned net sellers, offloading stocks worth Rs 4,227.3 crore.
  • Domestic investors remain active buyers, accumulating stocks worth Rs 820.6 crore over the last 13 sessions.
"Technically, on the daily chart, the Nifty formed a red candle, indicating profit booking, while on the weekly chart, it formed a green candle, indicating overall strength." - Hrishikesh Yedve

The prospects for the Nifty index remain optimistic as long as it consistently holds above its support levels, encouraging a buy-on-dips approach.
newTitle: Market Outlook: Nifty May Approach 24,650 With Breakout Above 24,130

title: Govt to switch on massive subsidy to supercharge EV infrastructure - Business Standard
summary:
Govt to Switch on Massive Subsidy to Supercharge EV Infrastructure

Publication Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The central government is set to provide substantial subsidies to enhance EV charging infrastructure across the country.

  • 80% or higher subsidy on infrastructure for electric public fast charging stations.
  • Scheme named PM Electric Drive Revolution in Innovative Vehicle Enhancement (PM eDRIVE).
  • Funds allocated include Rs 581 crore for 48,400 fast chargers for electric two- and three-wheelers.
  • Support for a total of 72,300 fast charging stations nationwide.
“The subsidy could increase to 100% in exceptional cases.”

This initiative aims to significantly boost the deployment of electric vehicles by addressing charging infrastructure deficiencies.
newTitle: Govt to Switch on Massive Subsidy to Supercharge EV Infrastructure

title: Govt to give 80% subsidy for EV fast chargers under PM E-Drive scheme - Business Standard
summary:
Govt to Give 80% Subsidy for EV Fast Chargers Under PM E-Drive Scheme

Publication Date: Jan 05 2025 | Source: Business Standard

The central government is launching a scheme to subsidize the installation of fast charging stations for electric vehicles, aiming to enhance the infrastructure for electric mobility across India.

  • The government will provide an 80% subsidy for setting up public fast charging stations.
  • The subsidy may increase to 100% under exceptional circumstances.
  • Funding is part of the Rs 2,000 crore PM Electric Drive Revolution scheme.
  • Support is earmarked for 48,400 fast chargers for two- and three-wheelers and 22,100 for electric vehicles.
The scheme aims to support 72,300 fast charging stations across the country.

This initiative is a significant step towards promoting electric vehicles in India, enhancing infrastructure, and reducing emissions.
newTitle: Govt to Provide 80% Subsidy for Electric Vehicle Fast Chargers

NTPC Renewable Energy Limited has emerged as a successful bidder for a 1000 MW solar power project, securing a competitive tariff while awaiting the letter of award from UPPCL.

title: FDI in India growing rapidly: Goyal - The Hindu
summary:
FDI in India growing rapidly: Goyal

Published: January 05, 2025 05:09 pm IST | Source: PTI

FDI inflows into India are surging as global investors recognize the country as a top investment destination. Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted that this trend is contributing to rapid economic growth and generating millions of jobs.

  • FDI from regions such as the Middle East, Japan, the EU, and the U.S. is increasing significantly.
  • Goyal emphasized India’s strong domestic market, skilled workforce, and predictable regulatory framework as key factors attracting investors.
  • The country has seen an increase of 42% in FDI, amounting to $42.13 billion in the January-September period of 2024.
  • Key sectors attracting investment include services, computer software and hardware, telecommunications, and more.
  • FDI is pivotal for infrastructure development and maintaining economic stability in India.
“I can clearly see FDI in India once again growing rapidly and creating millions of jobs.” - Piyush Goyal

The surge in foreign direct investment reflects India's growing prominence as an investment hub, crucial for future economic infrastructure development and stability.
newTitle: FDI in India growing rapidly: Goyal

title: Govt relents, relaxes GMP adoption deadline for small, medium pharmas after RSS-backed body weighs in - ThePrint
summary:
Govt relents, relaxes GMP adoption deadline for small, medium pharmas after RSS-backed body weighs in

Publication Date: Saturday, New Delhi

The government has proposed a one-year extension for small and medium drug manufacturers in India to adopt Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) norms due to pressure from Laghu Udyog Bharti, a RSS-backed organization.

  • The original deadline of December 31, 2024, has been pushed to December 31, 2025.
  • Approximately 10,500 drug manufacturing units exist in India, with 8,500 being small and medium enterprises.
  • 4,000 drugmakers are relieved by this extension due to uncertainty caused by the previous deadline.
“This decision will help the companies who have the intent to adopt Schedule M but had been unable to do so by the earlier deadline due to lack of resources and time.” - Viranchi Shah, IDMA President

The Ministry of Health stated that requests for an extension were made by various industry associations in the pharma MSME sector, citing the need for better financing and time for implementation.
newTitle: Govt Extends GMP Adoption Deadline for Small and Medium Pharmas

title: Record Car Sales In December 2024 Leads To New High: Details - GaadiWaadi.com
summary:
Record Car Sales In December 2024 Leads To New High: Details

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: GaadiWaadi

The festive season demand fuelled by the year-end discounts helped to boost car sales in December 2024, closing the year with a record high of 4.3 million units sold.

  • The Indian automotive market saw consistent growth towards the end of 2024.
  • Car sales increased by 10-12% from factories to dealerships, totaling about 320,000 to 325,000 units.
  • Maruti Suzuki led the market with sales of 130,115 units, marking a 24.2% year-over-year growth.
  • Tata Motors and Mahindra & Mahindra also reported significant increases in sales.
  • Hyundai and Kia experienced declines in their sales figures.
“The German twins, Skoda and Volkswagen’s sales declined by 2.5% and 2.9%, respectively. Jeep managed to sell just 286 units in December 2024, registering the highest YOY de-growth of 34.4%.”

This surge in car sales is attributed to strong demand during the festive season and year-end discounts, with expectations that the momentum will continue into 2025.
newTitle: Record Car Sales In December 2024 Leads To New High: Details

title: FDIC Wanted to Send Shockwaves Through Banks, According to Ripple's Top Lawyer - U.Today
summary:
FDIC Wanted to Send Shockwaves Through Banks, According to Ripple's Top Lawyer

Publication Date: Not specified Source: U.Today

Stuart Alderoty, chief legal officer at Ripple, has highlighted concerns regarding the FDIC's intimidating communication with banks, suggesting it aims to stifle crypto-related activities.

  • The FDIC sent letters to banks that Ripple's lawyer describes as an effort to shut down crypto activities.
  • Coinbase has obtained unredacted letters from the FDIC targeting a broad range of crypto activities.
  • The letters support claims of 'Operation Choke Point 2.0', which is alleged to target the crypto industry in a similar manner to previous government actions against high-risk activities.
  • Calls have arisen for Congress to investigate the alleged crackdown on crypto activities.
“The new Congress should launch hearings on all this without delay.” - Paul Grewal, Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase

This situation raises significant questions about government regulation of the cryptocurrency sector and its implications for the industry’s future.
newTitle: FDIC's Impact on Banks Under Scrutiny - Insights from Ripple's Lawyer

Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar now earns a remuneration three times higher than his previous salary while leading some major Indian companies.

  • Rajnish Kumar currently serves as Chairman of BharatPe and holds board positions at several major firms.
  • His total remuneration in FY2023 reached Rs 89 lakh from three firms.
  • During his tenure as SBI Chairman, he earned Rs 28 lakh annually.
  • Kumar was provided with a luxurious bungalow in Mumbai, costing an estimated Rs 2-2.5 crore to rent monthly.
  • The current SBI Chairman Challa Sreenivasulu Setty earns Rs 39.3 lakh annually.
  • Benefits for SBI Chairmen include medical insurance, paid vacations, and luxury accommodations.
“During my tenure as SBI Chairman, my annual salary was Rs 28 lakh despite overseeing a massive balance sheet of Rs 50 lakh crore.” - Rajnish Kumar

This article highlights the significant increase in remuneration for former SBI Chairmen and illustrates the luxurious perks associated with the position.

Foreign investors have pulled out ₹4,285 crore from Indian equities due to high valuations and global headwinds, reflecting a significant shift in market dynamics.

  • The outflow is attributed to rising global inflation and interest rates.
  • Investors are concerned about the sustainability of high valuations in Indian markets.

  • Experts warn that continued outflows could impact market stability.

summary:
Shein Returns to India with Reliance Retail Partnership

Publication Date: Jan 5, 2025 Source: ET Now

The Chinese affordable-fashion brand Shein is set to make a comeback in India by partnering with Reliance Retail, marking its re-entry after being blocked in 2019.

  • Shein's partnership with Reliance Retail comes after a four-year hiatus from the Indian market.
  • The brand has outpaced competitors like Nike, H&M, and Zara in website traffic.
  • Shein plans to offer its products on Reliance's fashion site, Ajio.com.
  • The partnership aims to leverage Indian manufacturers for Shein's product offerings.
“According to Similarweb data, Shein apparently surpassed all other fashion and clothing websites in terms of traffic in September 2024.”

Shein's return to the Indian market represents a significant move to reclaim its position in the fast-fashion segment, leveraging a new partnership that will foster local manufacturing.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Monday - The Economic Times
New York imposes first ever congestion pricing plan in US.. - Greatandhra
summary:
New York Implements First Congestion Pricing Plan in the US

Publication Date: Date Not Specified Source: Xinhua News Agency

A congestion pricing plan has been initiated in Manhattan, making New York City the first in the United States to adopt such a system.

  • Vehicles entering the congestion relief zone will be tolled based on vehicle type, time of day, and payment method.
  • This plan aims to reduce the number of vehicles in the zone by an estimated 10%.
  • The Metropolitan Transportation Authority (MTA) anticipates generating $1 billion annually from this plan.
  • Controversy surrounding the plan has resulted in multiple lawsuits, though implementation proceeded.
"The tolls would be adjusted upward in 2028 and 2031, phasing out 40% of initial discounts."

This congestion pricing initiative marks a significant shift in urban traffic management and aims to fund public transportation while reducing congestion in Manhattan.
newTitle: New York Implements First Congestion Pricing Plan in the US

title: AI to companies is like fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia shares interesting analogy | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
AI to Companies is Like Fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia Shares Interesting Analogy

Publication Date: January 5, 2025

Source: Live Mint

In a recent post, stock market investor Vijay Kedia likened the impact of artificial intelligence (AI) on companies to the transformative effect of refrigerators on the beverage industry, particularly on Pepsi and Coca-Cola.

  • Kedia stated that AI will enable users to innovate and benefit from the technology revolution, similar to how refrigerators benefited the beverage giants.
  • He emphasized that every company should adopt AI as a tool to enhance efficiency without necessarily developing their own software.
  • Social media reactions have supported Kedia's perspective on AI's widespread relevance and importance.
“Just as the invention of fridges enabled Pepsi and Coca-Cola to dominate globally, AI will empower users to create and innovate. The true beneficiaries of AI will be those who harness its potential, not just the developers.” — Vijay Kedia

In conclusion, Kedia's analogy offers insight into the potential of AI for businesses, stressing that like refrigerators, AI can drive competitiveness and growth in various sectors.
newTitle: AI to Companies is Like Fridge to Coca-Cola — Investor Vijay Kedia Shares Interesting Analogy
